gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata Part 2 Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: Dynamic Surface Water Extent from Sentinel-1 A/B Product

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The L3 Dynamic Surface Water Extent (DSWx) from Sentinel-1 (S1) product maps the surface water extent on a near-global geographical scale, i.e., all land mass excluding Antarctica. DSWx-S1 products are distributed over projected map coordinates aligned with the Military Grid Reference System (MGRS).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: File an issue or provide feedback
File an issue or provide feedback
File an issue or provide feedback

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data product generated in Cloud-Optimized GeoTIFF format with ISO 19115 conformant metadata.

eos:description.gco:CharacterString: Indicates that pixel values are assumed to represent an area rather than points
OPERA Project contact email address
The DSWx-S1 product version
Name of the generating Institution
The percentage of layover and shadow in the DSWx-S1 product based on OPERA RTC-S1 product
Number of actual bursts processed to derive the output MGRS product
Number of expected bursts needed to derive the output MGRS product
Number of expected bursts missing from the output MGRS product
DSWx-S1 product processing date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.
RTC intensity filtering method
Indicates if the filter is applied to the input RTC
Filtering window size
The foot and shoulder values used to construct an S-shaped function for water body areas
List of the intensity values to define dark land
Foot and shoulder value to construct a Z-shape function for height above nearest drainage (HAND)
The minimum and maximum values representing reference water levels to identify areas with frequent water extent changes
Foot and shoulder value to construct a S-shape function for reference water
Foot and shoulder value to construct a Z-shape function for slope angle
Indicates whether inundated vegetation is a factor in the processing
The cross-polarization backscattering value [dB] used to filter out areas for inundated vegetation mapping. The areas that have this threshold are automatically considered not-inundated vegetation.

The maximum threshold for the ratio of co-polarization to cross-polarization in mapping inundated vegetation. It defines the upper limit for this ratio, beyond which vegetation is not considered inundated.
The minimum threshold for the ratio of co-polarization to cross-polarization required to identify inundated vegetation
Threshold value for co-pol to cross-pol ratio used to map inundated vegetation areas
Threshold level [dB] to be used for dark land identification for co-polarization
Threshold level [dB] to be used for dark land identification for cross-polarization
Threshold to be used for dry region identification for reference water data. The fuzzy values computed from cross-polarization are replaced with the one from co-polarization
List of RTC-S1 polarizations used for DSWx-S1 products
Minimum number of pixels to pass to bimodality test
List of thresholds to determine if the distribution is close to bimodal distribution
Seed value for region-growing method
Tolerance value for region-growing method
Initial thresholding algorithm, either Kittler-Illingworth or OTSU

Bimodality threshold for identifying bimodality in data tiles. It is used to select tiles that exhibit bimodal distribution, essential for specific analyses where recognizing two distinct data groups is crucial.
Indicates a Boolean indicator specifying whether a trimodal distribution is assumed in the processing
Indicates whether averaging of thresholds within a tile is enabled or not.
Tile selection method (e.g. Tweles, Chini, Bimodality or combined)
Threshold value for tile selection using the 'twele' method
Product level
Source data for the product
Product type
Name of the project
Absolute orbit number copied from the OPERA RTC burst products
List of the burst ids used to generate the tile. Format: TrackNumber_BurstID_SwathNumber
List of input L1 SLC granules used
List of input RTC products used
Orbit direction (e.g. Ascending or Descending). Copied from OPERA RTC.
The version of the OPERA RTC algorithm used with the input RTC products
A flag to indicate whether RFI information is available in the source data.
Number of RTC bursts affected by RFI
Sensing end time. Latest acquisition time of OPERA burst RTC set. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
Sensing start time. Earliest acquisition time of OPERA burst RTC set. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
Track number copied from the OPERA RTC burst products
Name of the sensor instrument
The software version used to generate the DSWx-S1 product
Name of the sensor platform
The area percentage of the tile with data

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: OPERA L3 DSWx product generated by JPL using Sentinel-1 A/B input data and SAS version 0.4

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Dynamic Surface Water Extent (DSWx) Product - OPERA_L3_DSWx-S1
Reference DEM - Copernicus DEM GLO-30 2021 WGS84
Reference Water File - JRC Global Surface Water - collection from 1984 to 2021
Shoreline Shape File - NOAA GSHHS Level 1 resolution f - GSHHS_f_L1
